title: Moronic, naive deniers take note - whips are unnecessary for a great race
text:
The Long Distance Cup at Ascot on Saturday was as good a race as has been run all Flat season. Like Enable at Longchamp two weeks earlier, Stradivarius lost nothing in defeat on ground that did not suit him. Although Frankie Dettori rode the perfect race, Kew Gardens probably benefited more from the stop-start pace in the contest.

What was most gratifying, however, was that neither Dettori nor Donnacha O’Brien hit their venerable mounts behind the saddle during this fantastic tussle; reminding most sane people that the moronic, naive, whip-damage deniers need to accept that the whip contributes nothing to the spectacle of a great race. If racehorses are bred from the right stock, they will respond...
